snippet: At least five people were killed and dozens more injured when an Amtrak train carrying 243 people derailed, shutting down service in the Northeast region, the authorities said.
abstract: Amtrak train traveling from Washington to New York and carrying 243 people derails in Philadelphia, killing at least five people and injuring dozens.

byline.original: By JON HURDLE and ASHLEY SOUTHALL
byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle reported from Philadelphia, and Ashley Southall from New York.

lead_paragraph: At least five people were killed and dozens more injured when an Amtrak train carrying 243 people derailed, shutting down service in the Northeast region, the authorities said.

headline.main: Amtrak Train Derails in Philadelphia, Killing at Least 5 and Injuring Dozens
headline.print_headline: Amtrak Train Derails in Philadelphia, Killing at Least 5 and Injuring Dozens
